title: Certified Medical Assistant (CMA) Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Health First
Interview Descriptions: You will be contacted by a recruiter first, then if you make it through, you will go to a manager then, possibly another interview with the team. Make sure that you know about the values of the company! This is an important part of the job and the company!
Interview Questions: Define integrity in your own words. (This is part of the I-care values!)

title: Phlebotomy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Health First (Miami, FL) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: very fast and non complicated questions were asked. mostly about your experience and how you attach their core values to your everyday life. overall the interview processes is very fast and the recruiters are super friendly and helpful
Interview Questions: what are your strengths ?

title: Appeals Nurse Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Health First (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: It started with a 15 min phone call from a recruiter then the following week a 1 hr zoom call with two managers on video. They were professional yet friendly and wanted to know why I was interested in the company.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you handled a difficult situation inappropriately and what you could have done differently.

title: Customer Service Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Health First
Interview Descriptions: 1st Phone call followed by an in person and another phone call. The process is long and the talent acquisition team is not the greatest! Good luck if you pass the screening!
Interview Questions: What your prior positions required and references

title: Nurse Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Health First (Melbourne, FL) in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: Easy interview done via zoom. Basic interview questions. I got the job after one zoom interview. Training is a long process, lots of online course work to complete with mandatory in person days at the training center. Be sure to request off from your current position to accommodate these training days.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself, how do you do under pressure, why did you choose to apply to this unit

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Health First in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: Interview was done over Microsoft Teams with the Director. Lasted about 30 minutes. She asked me what questions I had for her, if any. She shared her vision for the role and what my tasks would look like.
Interview Questions: What experience did I have in similar roles. How do I view myself working with numbers and analyzing. How do I prioritize tasks. When was a time I had to be creative in solving a solution.

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Health First (Melbourne, FL) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with nurse recruiter as new grad. They were very friendly and easy to talk too. The recruiter was knowledgeable, and got back to me at a timely manner. The interview was recorder through the phone (COVID time) and sent to unit i applied too.
Interview Questions: why are you interested? strengths and weakness?

title: Nurse Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Health First (Melbourne, FL) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions:
The process consists of applying and being declined immediately.  One of this positions qualifications require that you be enrolled in an LPN/RN program and ypu must've completed at least the 1st Semester and so on....well get ready to hurry up and wait or to have all of your apps declined. Exactly what's happening to me. I meet ALL of the qualifications and because of that I was confused as to why I was being declined..so I asked and was told they don't hire LPNs so if I eas hired I'd be fired when done with school....
YET THE JOB SAYS LPN!! MAKE IT MAKE SENSE!! This place is terrible at hiring. The process is entirely too long and forget it if you've ever had a run in with anyone there or God forbid someone is threatened by your education and/or knowledge. They'll decline ypu because they're insecure and afraid you'll take their job.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Health Information Tech Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Health First
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview and in person interview.  The process was fairly fast. First I got an interview invitation on my email. I then did and electronic phone interview. I was then called for another interview
Interview Questions: What was a difficult situation you were in and how did you handle it.

title: Patient Services Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Health First (Melbourne, FL) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: Non-existent. I was scheduled for a 9AM teams interview with the hiring manager through a recruiter. I signed in on the laptop and even called in and nobody else came to the interview. I reached out to the hiring manager about this through LinkedIn but he never responded back. I also called the Health First hiring center. A different recruiter called back the next day and stated that the interview was cancelled and that someone else was hired for the position beforehand. when asking why I wasn't notified beforehand, he stated they have been having technical issues the past few days. He could not, however explain why someone could not have called me to inform that it was cancelled beforehand.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Business Intelligence Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Health First in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions:
Submitted through a recruiter. After a week or so they put the job on hold. Then a few weeks later reopened the job after a rewrite. Recruiter gets in touch and says the hiring manager wants to schedule an interview, likes what they see. Great! Scheduled the call on short notice and then after a few hours the call is cancelled.

Next day recruiter calls to say they are again rewriting the job duties/description. Hiring manager changes direction again, says background isn't a fit.

Time to move on. If this is an indication of how the dev environment is managed I'll pass, thank you very much.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Physical Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Health First
Interview Descriptions: 1) Preliminary phone interview 2) In-Person interview in clinic 3) Phone Call with HR for job offer. Very organized and professional process. I was not able to negotiate higher salary.
Interview Questions: They asked about my experience, strengths, and weaknesses.

title: Cardiac Sonographer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Health First
Interview Descriptions: Typical interview process. Reviewed job requirements and asked technical questions.  Nothing out of the order.  Be prepared to offer scenario based answers. Friendly series of interviews that weren’t too long in length.
Interview Questions: What is my formal education?

title: Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Health First (Melbourne, FL) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Difficult only because I have never applied as a phlebotomist but they made me feel comfortable.  Waiting to hear from the reqruting agent . Asked me questions on why do I want to work for this company 
How would I describe myself as a person 
Why should we hire you
Interview Questions:
What describes me 
What difficult situation have I been in that I resolved

title: New Nurse- Trauma Neuro Surgical Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Health First (Melbourne, FL) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: Easy interview, mostly the leadership for the floor telling me about the position and asking me what my favorite part of nursing is.  They said I would hear back from them and I got an offer letter the same day.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest weakness?

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Health First (Melbourne, FL)
Interview Descriptions: The entire process was pretty slow, each party was slow to respond, not kept updated on process, recruiter was nice but did not seem to know what the hiring parties were actually looking for.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Patient Service Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Health First in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was a two-step interview process. The first step is done through the phone (or computer) where you dial into a number and answer 4-5 pre-recorded questions. From here, I received a call from a hiring recruiter who set up a virtual interview with the supervisor and manager. Both the manager and supervisor were very friendly and created a relaxing environment.  Waiting to hear if I was selected.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself, where do you see yourself in the next five years

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Health First (Melbourne, FL) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: Automated questions over the phone,  received a call for an in person interview within an appropriate amount of time and was set up with an interview in the next few days.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a nurse?

title: Patient Observer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Health First (Melbourne, FL) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: My interview experience was great, we spoke in detail about the various aspects of the position and what experience I’ve had working in roles similar to this. There were some behavioral questions. All in all this was probably one of the better interview experiences I’ve had.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about a time where you dealt with a difficult customer, how did you turn the situation from a negative to a positive?

Most of the questions were very common place with what I’ve experienced with various other companies.

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Health First in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was quick. I got an email the next day to do an online interview and then following that were two additional interviews,  one with the recruiter and then the hiring manager.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about a time you handled a difficult situation?
What makes you a great candidate?

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Health First (Miami, FL) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: Phone screening and business interviews were well conducted and pleasant. Looking forward to hearing from the company on whether or not I was selected. So far I'm pleased with their interview performance.
Interview Questions: Explain with detail a notable professional accomplishment.

title: Health Coach Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Health First (Melbourne, FL)
Interview Descriptions: Interviewer was late and the had no structure to their questions. Was unprofessional. Questions didn't all apply to position. Expected me to know all their protocols and not willing to train.
Interview Questions: How would you explain congestive heart failure and the package we give to go home with?

title: Customer Service Representative (CSR) Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Health First (Rockledge, FL) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: Easy going. It was virtual and the management made you very comfortable. I was asked a total of 5 questions.  They were not hard.  Make sure to research the company and be ready. They want to make sure you are going to stay.
Interview Questions: They asked about the company and why you wanted to work there.

title: IT Field Services Tech II Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Health First (Melbourne, FL) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: Virtual interview due to Covid-19. Found the job listed through a college job site, yet I was told there were no entry-level positions available and my years in tech support were insufficient because it wasn't done in the sort of environment they wanted them in. Why post on a COLLEGE job site if you won't even consider an entry-level candidate?! It makes NO sense to me at all.
Interview Questions: What my IT background was, and how many years of experience I had?

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Health First (Melbourne, FL) in May 2020
Interview Descriptions: 30 minute phone call interview. The questions were very basic. The phone interview went well and I was told I could expect to hear back in 2 weeks. After follow up several times, i never heard anything back.
Interview Questions: Why did you chose to apply at this company?

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Health First (Melbourne, FL) in May 2020
Interview Descriptions: Screening interview and then team interview.  Much of the interviewing revolves around the core values of the company so make sure you are able to discuss related to your experience.  The interview is not overly-hard, but I was caught off-guard by the questions since I was expecting a more technical interview.
Interview Questions: What is our company's core values and give an example for each as you have demonstrated in your life before.

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Health First (Melbourne, FL) in May 2020
Interview Descriptions: HR called me to set up time for phone screening interview.  Phone Screening Interview with general questions and then Zoom Team Interview about two weeks later with more specific questions.
Interview Questions: List the company's core values and give examples of how you exhibit these values.

title: HIM Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Health First in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: The initial interview process was automated. Everything was set up and completed online. I was sent an email and asked to answer a series of questions. I was then provided a phone number to call to answer a series of questions over the phone. My responses were recorded and sent to the company for further review.
Interview Questions: Have you ever had difficulty completing a task? Why? How was it solved?

title: Nurse Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Health First
Interview Descriptions: 10 minute interview, the managers seemed interested , thought it went well only to find out I was not offered the position because They hired a candidate that was a better fit yet I was 100% qualified for the position.  I was turned down for personal reasons is my guess.
Interview Questions: How I handled a difficult patient

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Health First
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview followed by face to face. Panel group interview on the unit, and a brief tour of the unit. A few questions asked by each interviewer, mostly conflict resoultion and personality based questions.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you had a conflict and what you did to resolve it

title: Patient Services Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Health First (Melbourne, FL) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: First I filled out application online, then scheduled an interview which included answering pre-recorded questions which felt very impersonal. Didn't hear anything for a while and then got an email that I was rejected.
Interview Questions: Describe your biggest achievement in your life.

title: Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Health First (Providence, KY) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: I was asked to drive 55 miles from my location to interview. The interview lasted about an hour. I never received an email or phone call of the outcome. Company completely ghosted me.
Interview Questions: Why would I be a good fit for the company

title: Medical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Health First (Melbourne, FL) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: they were starting with screening interviews, which is on the phone to find only the most qualified applicants for the job.  then it followed by in-person interviews. After assessing the candidates, the company decides which applicant will be offered the position
Interview Questions: How do you feel about working on a team

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Health First
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview for an internship position. The Recruiter asked me about my previous experience and my knowledge about the company as well as the health care industry. She also asked me a few personalities, behavioral questions, which she didn't seem bothered to listen even though she initiated it. Although, as a student, I need experience, but based on the experience that I had through the phone interview, I would rather not work for this company.
Interview Questions: Out of our mission values: Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, Excellence--which one most resonates with you?

title: RN New to Practice Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Health First in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was a recorded phone interview. They had pre-recorded questions and I had to record it. There were no redos, but it was pretty simple to do. They are keeping me updated, but I am still waiting on a decision to possibly go further.
Interview Questions: Why are you the best person for this job?

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Health First (Melbourne, FL) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: Initial telephone interviews were very engaging.  Interviewer was enthusiastic and conveyed genuine excitement about the potential my skills and experience could bring to the organization. Overall the interviews (3) were very pleasant and informative.
Interview Questions: Describe your most challenging situation as a program manager, and how did you respond to it?

title: Non-Medical Stretcher Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Health First in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: I had two interviews, one over the phone and a face to face with the supervisor. Everything went very smooth in both processes of the interview and I was very glad I made the choice to join the Health First family for employment.
Interview Questions: Why do I want to work for their company? I replied that I'm a great people person and I was willing to help others no matter what even though I did not have a medical background.

title: Graduate Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Health First
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received an email for a phone interview. It was a recording of a few questions and then they recorded my answers. A lot of questions that required examples. Still haven't heard one way or the other after 2 weeks.
Interview Questions: Which of their values resonated the most with me and why.

title: IT Field Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Health First (Rockledge, FL) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: Telephone based interview, very friendly and helpful. Plenty of the typical qualification questions, and a few of the behavioral type. I was quite amazed at the professional and helpful interviewer, even though I performed terribly. Quick response following interview. Even though it was not the response I wanted, it was very nice to have an answer right away!
Interview Questions: Relate an instance where you used bad judgement for a previous employer, and what you did to correct it.

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Health First in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: The first round of the interview was a phone interview. It was a 30 minutes interview and they ask you about your background, relocation, salary expectation. So, I would definitely recommend Glassdoor to check the salary range so that you are on the same page when an interviewer asks you about salary expectations.
Interview Questions: Tell me something about your background and how this position is relevant to you?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Health First (Melbourne, FL) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was smooth and very personable. The interviewer asked detailed questions. I was able to answer, and ask questions if needed. I actually enjoyed the experience. I was a little worried about the lack of feedback after the interview.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest accomplishment?

title: Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Health First (Viera, FL) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: They sent me an email and asked me to go on line and set an interview time that works for me.  The website was not working and ended p having to call to set an interview.
Interview Questions: What made you apply for a position at health first

title: Lean Engineer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Health First
Interview Descriptions: It was a phone interview conducted by a Human Resource executive who asked me about my education background, my strengths, my career plans in the future and invited me to ask any questions about the company etc.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: PACU Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Health First (Port Saint Lucie, FL) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: First phone interview with Human resources. Second call by Human Resources for phone interview with manager of department. Mileage needs to be less than 30 min away for call. First phone interview questions on patient experiences.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Director of HIM Operations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Health First (Rockledge, FL) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: Working with their talent acquisition team initially, prior to onsite interview, was pleasant.  First discussion with hiring manager was via phone and was good enough to schedule a onsite interview.  The onsite interview went very well.  Throughout the day, the hiring manager made comments that he was definitely interested in offering me the job, but not coming right out and saying it at that time.  He ended the day with saying that he feels we would be a great fit and the next step may be to bring me back onsite to meet his boss.  However, he did have a few other internals and one external to interview over the next few weeks.  Which he stated that the internals, as he feels, are not ready for this level of management and that the external did not have the innovation that he needs in this role.  Well, 3 and 4 weeks went by and no follow up was received from either the hiring manager or their talent acquisition team.  Therefore, I sent an email to talent acquisition, two/three days later no response.  I called them and left a voicemail, again, 2-3 days no response.  So I decided to email the hiring manager directly to get a response.  Within 30 minutes, talent acquisition called me.  Finally, received word that they offered to someone else.  Terrible follow through post interview from this group of individuals. I hope that this is not the case across the whole organization.  Candidates need to hear soon after an interview what decision was made.  Especially when the hiring manager practically offered during the interview, without coming out and saying it right then and there.
Interview Questions: The last question the hiring manager asked me was about my interest after meeting with them today and he felt this was going to be a perfect fit.

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Health First
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was contacted by an out of state recruiter. It's confusing that a company that is based out of Brevard County, FL has recruiters in Wisconsin and Pennsylvania. Why not just have a team of recruiters locally--as Brevard County could certainly use more jobs. Also, it's frustrating that the pay range they list on LinkedIn is false advertisement as I was told during the phone screen it was actually  $20,000 less per year than the listed range.
Interview Questions: Out of our mission values: Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, Excellence--which one most resonates with you?

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Health First (Melbourne, FL) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Interview with three people. One of them was a vice president and another vice president and two other executive assistants, Enjoyed talking with them. This was my second time interviewing for an executive assistant position and have noticed at this level of administrative support, do not see much diversity. Can't help but wonder if this is the reason I don't get the offers.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you?

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Health First
Interview Descriptions: A phone interview was conducted almost 2 months back and yet to receive feedback or information regarding the next steps although the recruiter said they would mail or call in a week. It shows no value for people who are waiting to hear from them.
Interview Questions: Behavioral type questions

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Health First (Melbourne, FL) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: Very long and drawn out.  The time frame given for a response to your interview was not met.  I  called several times and was told I would have an answer by the end of the week.  They got back to me with a job offer 3 months later!  By that time I had taken another job.  From other nurses I know who have applied this is not uncommon.
Interview Questions: What are your goals for the next 5 years.

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Health First (Melbourne, FL) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: Started with a phone interview, then in person interview (accepted position right then and there), and finally orientation which is lengthly. If I recall correctly, their was about 2-3 weeks of orientation.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Health First (Viera, FL) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: They had to reschedule my original appointment but didn't tell me why. Phone interview was very quick and easy. They asked very basic behavioral job questions. lasted about 20 minutes. They said they would let me know about setting up a face-to-face interview
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Health First?

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Health First (Melbourne, FL) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: They make the interview process very easy and convenient. The initial one was done via telephone and then there was a face to face interview. I am still waiting to hear if I have been selected or not but it's been a good experience so far.
Interview Questions: What are your long term and short term goals?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Health First (Melbourne, FL)
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by sit-in assistant manager. She seems friendly, but no critical questions which I didn't understand how she used my interview to determine my critical thinking skills and performance. Questions type: standard behavior questions that you see online.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for health first?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Health First
Interview Descriptions: Recruiting/ HR rep will call and ask a bunch of questions after your application is submitted online. These questions seem to determine to some degree the opportunity that will be offered.
Interview Questions: Interview in person on unit was more geared to critical thinking, problem solving, and managing potential conflict resolution among coworkers and clients.

title: Claims Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Health First (Melbourne, FL) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Received email to set up phone interview.  Was able to choose date and time.  Then received phone call from the recruiter.  Very pleasant.  The questions they ask are very simple and basic.
Interview Questions: They asked about knowledge of medical claims.

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Health First in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Recruiter , VP, Dept head (via phone), five online tests, then a psychologist.  The next step would be a final round...which ironically would have been the first time the candidates get to see the place.  Pretty outlandish process to work for meh wages and benefits at a hospital.  Too many red flags throughout, and when the recruiter didn't return my email after I spent five hours on a Saturday taking their tests, I withdrew.  If they need five tests and a psychologist to validate a hiring decision...that's just pathetic.
Interview Questions: Standard behavioral based.  The psychologist interview was mostly about motivation in taking/leaving positions

title: Business Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Health First in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Talent Acquisition rescheduled this interview at least four times. When I finally interviewed with the hiring manager, they told me the department was restructured, the job description changed, and as such I was no longer interested (or qualified). Total waste of time.
Interview Questions: Is the new role something that you would be interested in?

title: Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Health First (Rockledge, FL)
Interview Descriptions: Had a phone interview and all went well. At the end of the interview the person stated he wanted to move to face to face interview. Waited more than 2 weeks and finally got a call to set up interview. The interview was a 4 person panel. Each took turns asking questions while the other 3 furiously took notes. Mostly behavioral questions, "tell me about a time....".  All went well. Toured the facility. I was told I would hear back on next steps. Never heard a word. No email. Nothing. Very unprofessional. I spent a lot of time between the phone interview and taking time off my job to complete in person interview. It is very disrespectful not to even respond via email at the very least. I will not apply again here.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had a conflict with a supervisor and how did you handle it.

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Health First (Melbourne, FL) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very relaxed and inviting. Got to talk and it felt less like an interview and more like a conversation. Made me very comfortable and the process a lot less stressful.
Interview Questions: Where I see myself in 5 years.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Health First in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: After applying, I was contacted via email to set up a phone interview.  The interviewer was 10 minutes late and then proceeded to ask me the same questions that were on the web application that I already answered.
Interview Questions: The questions were very generic. The interviewer asked the same questions that were listed on the application.

title: Patient Experience Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Health First (Melbourne, FL) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: You apply online, go through a phone interview, then through a face to face interview. It can range from 3-7 people interviewing you. They like to have panels and stick with behavioral interviewing. From there, you will find out if you get the job or not.
Interview Questions: When was the last time you got caught doing something you shouldn't on the job or in life and how did you seek forgiveness?

title: Clerical Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Health First (Cape Canaveral, FL) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: I received a phone call asking me to come in for an interview the following week. I went into the interview, it was 20 minutes late. The lady was very nice, informative, and talked a lot.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Health First (Melbourne, FL) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: Submitted my resume online and got a call next day to setup phone interview which went very well. I got email to setup a face to face interview.  Because I applied for other positions, I did another phone interview. This interview with Scott, was unprofessional because he seemed preoccupied and hurried to get through my answers - that interview lasted all of 10 minutes as compared to my first one. Needless to say, I didn't get contacted back from my 1st interview for the face to face because this person was hurried and assumptive.  I'm very disappointed in the professionalism.
Interview Questions: Basic interview questions like what was your biggest mistake in a previous job and how you recovered, How do you work with others, etc....

title: CNA/HHA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Health First in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: I filled out the application online, I was called a day later. It was easy and smooth. I enjoyed the questions the asked, the way they went over the skills portion.
Interview Questions: How did you hear about us?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Health First (Melbourne, FL) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: All interviewees were late it started 20 minutes later than it should have. They were unprofessional and were constantly on their phones and walking in an out of the room while I was answering questions. Felt like a total waste of time, especially since I had to drive all the way from a city 4 hours away.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in the OR?

title: Medical Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Health First (Fort Worth, TX) in Oct 2015
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Business Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Health First (Melbourne, FL) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Initial phone interview with hr generalist to determine if I was the right candidate to move on to the next phase of the interview process. Asked general questions: prior experience, familiarity with position applying for, availability, salary expectations, etc. At the conclusion, the interviewer said they will recommend me for next steps. Two weeks passed and finally heard back that I would have a 2nd interview.
I was contacted 30-minutes prior on the day of my second interview that they changed the position requirements and now need someone with oncology experience.
Not a good way to attract and retain talent, especially in this area where word-of-mouth travels quickly. I was warned by former employees this is not a good place to work; this interview process proves the point.
Interview Questions: How many years of medical billing experience do you have?

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Health First in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions:
3 interviews, 2 phone 1 in person. 
Spoke with HR, hiring manager and then panel interview. Process took about 2 months. After panel interview I was told I would hear back in 3 weeks. Was notified in less than a week for an offer.
Interview Questions: behavioral questions

title: IT Customer Support Specialist I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Health First (Rockledge, FL) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Apply online. Wait a few days to be contacted by Staffing, then setup interview 2 weeks out with staffing then if select to move on you get interviewed over the phone again for the position.
Interview Questions: Basic behavioral customer service questions

title: General Sonographer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Health First (Sebastian, FL) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Phone interview after receiving my online application. I was emailed by the interviewer and set up a time for phone interview. The phone call was prompt and the interviewer was very regimented. Robotic and not friendly. 
I wasn't prepared for a couple of questions.
Interview Questions: What mistakes have you made as a technologist and how would you correct them.

title: HRA Verifier Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Health First (Tampa, FL)
Interview Descriptions: Two months after applying, I received a call from HR and given the details on the interview location, etc. I was given a very brief description of the job which turned out to be temporary and surprising as I had not applied for a part time position. Was told that HR would contact me.
Interview Questions: There were no questions asked of me, I had to ask questions to gain a better idea of what was expected of someone in that job position.

title: Front Desk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Health First in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, was contacted for a phone interview a few days after and was told I would receive a follow up call. I never had a face to face interview
Interview Questions: When did you demonstrate "integrity" in the work place

title: Member Services Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Health First (Lake Mary, FL) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very easy interview. When you are called to the conference room they ask you what your availability is and if you can work any schedule between 8am-8pm. Pretty basic questions like why do you want to work for the company,why should they hire you, and other behaviorial questions.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you?

title: Medical Transcriptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Health First (Rockledge, FL)
Interview Descriptions: Met with HR Department for initial interview after interviewed with supervisor.  Interviewed with 2 people at the same time and then given a transcription test, then followed up with results and more questions, making me feel judged on everything and uncomfortable.
Interview Questions: Was asked personal questions making me feel uncomfortable about working with past supervisor and problems prompting me to leave.

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Health First
Interview Descriptions: Handled by a headhunter
Interview Questions: There were no unexpected questions but they were behavior based

title: Case Management Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Health First (Melbourne, FL) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: The process was fairly simple. Phone interview and background check. I met with the supervisor who asked a few quesstions. It is mostly about qualifications. The next step was Human Resources. This took time due to the extensive background check.
Interview Questions: What are your goals?

title: Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Health First (Rockledge, FL) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Very basic questions, asked about leadership qualities, ability to work on a team, abilities in excel were very important, they are looking for people who are knowledgeable in Excel, especially in the use pf pivot tables.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 3-5 years?

title: Certified Surgical Scrub Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Health First in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: All resumes have to go through their online database. After submitting mine, I received a call for an interview within a day or two. After one short interview and walk though, I was called by their HR dept and offered a job. I started the following day.
Interview Questions: Very few questions actually. The hiring manager spent most of the time explaining their specific policies and the environment at their facility. I mostly just interjected with comments about how much I liked what she was saying and how I thought I would be a good fit for their team based on what she was saying.

title: Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Health First (Cape Canaveral, FL) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions:
My interview with Melissa Smith went very well.  She explained what was needed of her associates, Explained that  I would also be training in the Lab Dept., asked a few questions about Draw of Blood, then proceeded with a tour of the Lab Dept.
Once I was hired I had 3wks of training in both Lab Dept., and Out Patient.  Not so much time was spent on the floor actually doing pokes.  I enjoyed myself and learned more then I came in with
Interview Questions: question;  If you were an animal, which animal would you be?

title: Housekeeper Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Health First (Viera, FL) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was met and spoken to in the lobby of hospital by general manager and morning supervisor. I was then asked a few questions and then had the position, the layout of the facility and what was expected from me described to me. I was introduced to the morning supervisor told that I should hear a result in a few days.
Interview Questions: Experience, contributions

title: Ed Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Health First (Melbourne, FL) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was friendly and steady with questions and answers. 2 to 3 people asking questions and answers were recorded. There was a job duty walk through to experience the environment and location of things and where people are.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Health First (Melbourne, FL) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: Pretty basic they called me to set up an interview. It was actually an easy interview they asked the basic questions. Why do you want to work for us, what can you bring to the company. The other questions were scenarios what would you do if this happened ect. It was no more than 12 questions. Then they called me the 2 weeks later an offered me the job.
Interview Questions: Since Health First in a medical company it was a lot of patient care questions. Can you be trusted with patients valuables, What would you do it a patients fell on the floor and the same time another patient who was bed rest got out of bed… questions like that.
